Pavilion of Prince Teng

Grants a free [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer. Provides +1 [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer point and +3 [ICON_Production] Production for each [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer earned. Must be built next to a River adjacent to a Theater Square district.
“The sunset is flying together with lonely wild goose, and the autumn water connected the sky at the horizon forming a unity.”[NEWLINE]– Wang Bo

Located on the east bank of the Gan River in Nanchang, the Pavilion of Prince Teng earned its namesake from its builder Li Yuanying, Emperor Gaozu of Tang’s twenty-second son enfeoffed as Prince Teng. The wooden pavilion was vulnerable to fire and thus rebuilt many times, and earned its fame from the many literary works that describe its spectacular architecture and stunning scenery. When Pavilion of Prince Teng was rebuilt for the first time, twenty years after its construction, the rebuilder Yan Boyu celebrated the event with a banquet for the literati. Wang Bo, a poet traveling through this region at that time, wrote the famous “Preface to Pavilion of Prince Teng” during the banquet. Thanks to his masterpiece, the Pavilion has since become a renowned landmark in Jiangxi region. The last reconstruction of Pavilion of Prince Teng was completed in 1989, according to the design plan of architect Liang Sicheng to reproduce the archaic pavilion structure of “three floors exposed outside, seven stories actually inside”.
Chen Zi’ang
Thirty Eight Poems Occasioned by Encounters
The saint never cares for his part,[NEWLINE]For he is dedicated to save the humankind.[NEWLINE]Yao seeks not the imperial cart,[NEWLINE]Nor the jade terrace came to his mind.
Song on Ascending the Youzhou Terrace
Ahead, I see no sages of the past,[NEWLINE]Behind, I see no sages yet unborn.[NEWLINE]Reflecting on heaven and earth eternal,[NEWLINE]Lamenting in tears, I am forlorn.

Chen Zi’ang was a pioneer of the Tang Dynasty‘s literary renewal movement, and is praised as the ”Bone of Poetry“ and the ”Ancestor of Tang Poetry“. Born in 661, Chen Zi’ang spent his early years indulging in entertainments, but later aspired to strive for excellence and attained a government position through imperial examination.

Chen Zi’ang was recognized by Wu Zetian for his honest advice, but he was also demoted as his advice was too blunt. He had followed the army on campaign to the north, and wrote “Song on Ascending the Youzhou Terrace” in the journey. He rejected the flamboyant writing style of the Southern Dynasties, and in the name of restoring Han and Wei poetry, he revolutionized poetry of the Tang Dynasty.
Chen Zi’ang later resigned his position and returned to his hometown to look after his father of old age, but he was falsely accused died in prison in 700.
He Zhizhang
Ode to the Willow

The tall tree dressed in the green of jades,[NEWLINE]The myriad twigs drooped like silken braids.[NEWLINE]The leaves are fine yet none knows the tailor,[NEWLINE]For the vernal winds are sharp as scissors‘ blades.
On Homecoming

I left home young, now old, I return care free;[NEWLINE]My tongue unchanged, my hair though thinner be.[NEWLINE]Unknown am I to the boys and girls I meet;[NEWLINE]Smiling they ask, “Sir, from whence come thee?”
He Zhizhang was a poet of the Tang Dynasty. He was born in 659. His talents in literature were well-known since his youth, and he was granted a position in the court.

Though he held a high government position, he was actually a passionate man who loved drinking and befriending talented people. At the age of 84, he met Li Bai who came to Chang‘an seeking a position. After reading the poems of Li Bai, He Zhizhang befriended Li Bai despite their difference of ages and social status.

As He Zhizhang grew old, he donated his estates for Taoist monasteries, resigned his position and returned his hometown. On his journey, he wrote well-known poems like Ode to the Willow and On Homecoming. He died of sickness in 744.
Luo Binwang
Ode to Geese
Goose, goose, goose,[NEWLINE]You bend your neck towards the sky and sing.[NEWLINE]Your white feathers float on the emerald water,[NEWLINE]Your red feet push the clear waves.
Proclaimation against Wu Zhao On Behalf of Xu Jingye
Once she got in the palace, she would not yield even in her brows; She falsely implicated others, and she used her fox-like charms to delude the emperor.
Luo Binwang was one of the Four Paragons of the Early Tang. He was a child prodigy who could write the Ode to Geese at the age of seven.

Luo Binwang was once an official at the court, but he was falsely accused and imprisoned, later demoted as a local official. When Xu Jingye rebeled against Wu Zetian, Luo Binwang wrote the Proclaimation against Wu Zhao On Behalf of Xu Jingye. It was said that when Wu Zetian read the proclaimation, she was displeased - not because of Luo Binwang’s offence, but because Luo Binwang was talented and the chancellors failed to keep him in the court.

When Xu Jingye was defeated, Luo Binwang fled and disappeared. Some claimed that he committed suicide by drowning himself, while other claimed he became a Buddhist monk and journey among the mountains.
Lu Zhaolin
Chang’an, in Ancient Style
They fear not death if they can form couples like flatfish,[NEWLINE]They envy not the immortals if they can be bonded like mandarin ducks.
Lotus in a Curved Lake

Floating fragrance wraps around the curved shore,[NEWLINE]Round leaves covers over the flowery lake.[NEWLINE]I always fear the autumn wind comes too early,[NEWLINE]As you would see no flower but flake.

Lu Zhaolin was one of the Four Paragons of the Early Tang. He was once the Dianqian of Prince Teng, and his talents were praised by Prince Teng as ”my Xiangru (Xiangru was a renowned writer of the Han Dynasty)“. Later, he moved to Sichuan Basin.
Lu Zhaolin later suffered a crippling disease. Even the great physician Sun Simiao could not fully cure him. His poetry style turned from a passionate one to a gravely pessimistic one.
In 689, Lu Zhaolin ended his life by drowning himself in the Ying River.
Wang Bo
Preface to the Pavilion of Prince Teng
The sunset is flying together with lonely wild goose, and the autumn water connected the sky at the horizon forming a unity.
Farewell to Prefect Du

Watching over the Three Qin protected by tall walls,[NEWLINE]Gazing over the Five Crossings shrouded by misty squalls.[NEWLINE]I feel on parting sad and drear,[NEWLINE]For both of us are strangers here.[NEWLINE]If you have friends who know your heart,[NEWLINE]Distance cannot keep us apart.[NEWLINE]At crossroads where we bid adieu,[NEWLINE]Let us not shed tears as children do!

Wang Bo was one of the Four Paragons of the Early Tang. He was born in 650, and was known as a child prodigy in literature. He was an official without actual power, but a crime caused him to lose his position. His father was collectively punished and demoted to Jiaozhi.

He traveled to meet with his father, and visited Hongzhou on his journey. At that time, Yan Boyu rebuilt the Pavilion of Prince Teng, and invited poets for a banquet of celebration. Yan Boyu intended to have his son-in-law to write a preface for the celebration, but to show he was fair and open-minded, he pretended to invite the guests to write the preface. While other guests knew his intention and turned down the offer, Wang Bo ignored and wrote the Preface to the Pavilion of Prince Teng without preparation. This great work was considered his masterpiece.
Wang Bo continued his journey to meet with his father, but he fell into water on his way back. He died in 676.
Yang Jiong
Marching with the Armies

A string of bright beacon fires lights up the Capital;[NEWLINE]My blood's boiling, my heart's crying out for battle.[NEWLINE]Leaving Chang‘an with royal warrant hastily,[NEWLINE]Armored cavalries aim to besiege the Longcheng city.[NEWLINE]Painted banners are dimmed by the heavy snows pelting,[NEWLINE]Thundering war drums are heard amidst the gusts howling.[NEWLINE]O, To be a fighting centurion I'd be most willing,[NEWLINE]Rather than a verse-reciting scholarly weakling!
Farewell to Zhao Zong at Night
Seeing Zhao‘s jade disc of renown,[NEWLINE]Of fame wide spread reaching Heaven’s seams.[NEWLINE]I see you off to your home town;[NEWLINE]You shine with the moon on all streams.

Yang Jiong was one of the Four Paragons of the Early Tang. He was born in 650. Though he had displayed his literary talents and entered the Hongwen College as a kid, he only earned the lowest position in the court at the age of 30.

Later, he was promoted to serve as a scholar in Chongwen College, but as his relative joined the uprising of Xu Jingye, he was collectively punished and demoted to Sichuan. The up-and-downs in his careers even exerted influence in his poetry style.
Yang Jiong later became the Magistrate of Yingchuan Country, and died while in office.

落霞与孤鹜齐飞，秋水共长天一色。[NEWLINE]——王勃

滕王阁位于南昌赣江东岸，得名于其建造者滕王李元婴（唐高祖二十二子）。这座木制楼阁多次毁于火灾，经历多次重建，因众多记述其壮观建筑和绝美景色的文学巨作而闻名。滕王阁在建造二十年后首次重修时，重修者阎伯屿宴请文人雅士庆祝此事，当时途径此地的诗人王勃即在宴会中写下千古名篇《滕王阁序》，滕王阁自此成为名扬天下的江西地标。滕王阁的最后一次重建于1989年完成，按照建筑师梁思成的设计方案，重现「明三暗七」的古风楼阁结构。
陈子昂
《感遇诗三十八首》
圣人不利己，[NEWLINE]忧济在元元。[NEWLINE]黄屋非尧意，[NEWLINE]瑶台安可论。
《登幽州台诗》
前不见古人，[NEWLINE]后不见来者。[NEWLINE]念天地之悠悠，[NEWLINE]独怆然而涕下。
陈子昂是唐朝文学革新运动的先驱者，有“诗骨”和“唐诗诗祖”之称。他生于661年，早年耽于逸乐，后来立志奋发图强，登进士第。
获得官职的陈子昂因谏言得到武则天的赏识，却也因犯颜直谏怀才不遇。他曾经跟随军队出征北方，在幽州台写下《登幽州台诗》。他摒弃南朝华而不实的文风，以复古汉魏行革新诗文，影响了后世唐代的诗歌风格。
陈子昂后来以父亲老迈解官回乡，却遭受诬告下狱，在700年冤死狱中。
贺知章
《咏柳》
碧玉妆成一树高，[NEWLINE]万条垂下绿丝绦。[NEWLINE]不知细叶谁裁出，[NEWLINE]二月春风似剪刀。
《回乡偶书》
少小离家老大回，[NEWLINE]乡音无改鬓毛衰。[NEWLINE]儿童相见不相识，[NEWLINE]笑问客从何处来。
贺知章是唐代的诗人。他生于659年，年少时便以文才知名，被授予官职。
贺知章位高权重，却是热爱喝酒与结识才士的性情中人。贺知章八十四岁时，遇到前往长安求官的李白，在读过李白作品后结为忘年好友。
年迈的贺知章将宅地舍为道观，告老还乡，途中写下《咏柳》和《回乡偶书二首》等名篇，未几病逝于744年。
骆宾王
《咏鹅》
鹅，鹅，鹅，[NEWLINE]曲项向天歌。[NEWLINE]白毛浮绿水，[NEWLINE]红掌拨清波。
《为徐敬业讨武曌檄》
入门见嫉，蛾眉不肯让人。[NEWLINE]掩袖工谗，狐媚偏能惑主。
骆宾王是初唐四杰之一。他是诗歌的神童，七岁便写下《咏鹅》一诗。
骆宾王曾任官职，却被人诬陷入狱，后被贬官。当徐敬业起兵讨伐武则天，骆宾王写下《为徐敬业讨武曌檄》，根据记载，当武则天阅读檄文后不悦——不是因为檄文中伤，而是因为骆宾王的文采出众而宰相没有重用。
徐敬业兵败后，骆宾王逃亡不知所终，有说是投水自尽，也有说是出家为僧遍游名山。
卢照邻
《长安古意》
得成比目何辞死，愿作鸳鸯不羡仙。
《曲池荷》
浮香绕曲岸，[NEWLINE]圆影覆华池。[NEWLINE]常恐秋风早，[NEWLINE]飘零君不知。
卢照邻是初唐四杰之一。他曾任邓王府典签，被邓王称为“吾之相如”，后来调至蜀地。
卢照邻后来染上风疾，尽管得到名医孙思邈的医治，亦无法痊癒，诗歌的风格也由早年的激昂慷慨变得悲凉厌世。
在689年，卢照邻不堪病痛折磨，于颖河投水自尽。
王勃
《滕王阁序》
落霞与孤鹜齐飞，秋水共长天一色。
《送杜少府之任蜀州》
城阙辅三秦，风烟望五津。[NEWLINE]与君离别意，同是宦游人。[NEWLINE]海内存知己，天涯若比邻。[NEWLINE]无为在歧路，儿女共沾巾。
王勃是初唐四杰之一。他生于650年，少时已能写诗作赋。他曾为朝散郎，后来获罪失去官职，父亲亦受牵连贬官交趾。
当王勃前往交趾探望父亲路过洪州时，正值洪州都督阎伯屿重修滕王阁，设宴款待文人雅士。阎伯屿想让女婿为文会作序夸耀，又假意邀请宾客作序以示谦让。当其他宾客推辞之际，王勃却提笔就作，写下千古名篇《滕王阁序》。
王勃继续旅程探望父亲，却在回程时不慎落水，于676年去世。
杨炯
《从军行》
烽火照西京，心中自不平。[NEWLINE]牙璋辞凤阙，铁骑绕龙城。[NEWLINE]雪暗凋旗画，风多杂鼓声。[NEWLINE]宁为百夫长，胜作一书生。
《夜送赵纵》
赵氏连城璧，[NEWLINE]由来天下传。[NEWLINE]送君还旧府，[NEWLINE]明月满前川。
杨炯是初唐四杰之一。他生于650年，少有文才，待制弘文馆却官运坎坷，三十岁才获得九品下的校书郎一职。
杨炯后来被推荐为崇文馆学士，官运有所起色，后来却因亲戚跟随徐敬业起兵而受牵连被贬官至四川。官运的高低起落甚至影响了杨炯不同时期的诗风。
其后，杨炯出任盈川县令，卒于任上。
